'''Sydney Penny''' (born August 7, 1971 in [[Nashville, Tennessee]]) is an American [[Daytime Emmy]]-nominated actress best known for the roles of [[Julia Santos|Julia Santos Keefer]] on the [[soap opera]] ''[[All My Children]]'' and [[Samantha Kelly|Samantha "Sam" Kelly]] on the [[CBS]] soap opera ''[[The Bold and the Beautiful]]''.
She is of part [[Cherokee]] descent<ref>http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0001607/bio</ref> and raised in [[Chatsworth, California]], the daughter of former Western Swing bandleader and comedian [[Hank Penny]] and his wife, Shari. An early acting appearance was on the [[miniseries]] ''[[The Thorn Birds]]'' when she was only 12 years old as young Meggie. She also appeared as Dani in ''[[The New Gidget]]'' and as a [[pigeon]]-obsessed youngster in an episode of the cop series ''[[TJ Hooker]]''.
She also voiced [[Lucy van Pelt]] in the television special ''[[It's Magic, Charlie Brown]]'' (1981).
She played the role of Julia Santos Keefer on the [[soap opera]] ''[[All My Children]]'', from 1993 to 1996, with guest appearances in 1997 and 2002 and returned to the show in 2005. Penny left the show May 2008 when Julia was killed off.
Penny has also appeared on the serials ''[[Santa Barbara (TV series)|Santa Barbara]]'' as [[B.J. Walker]] during 1992-1993, ''[[Sunset Beach]]'' as [[Meg Cummings]] (filling in for [[Susan Ward]] in 1999), "[[Beverly Hills, 90210]]" and ''[[Hyperion Bay]]'' as Jennifer.
In August 2003, she was cast as [[Samantha Kelly]] on ''[[The Bold and the Beautiful]]''.<ref name="2007sow">{{cite news | title=Buzz | date=2007-02-13 | publisher= ''Soap Opera Weekly''| page = 8 }}</ref> The character never caught on and Penny was bumped to recurring status in late 2004. She last aired April 26, 2005 and rejoined ''All My Children'' a few months later. She would stay with the show for an additional three years.
Penny has remained good friends with her former co-star on ''AMC'', [[Sarah Michelle Gellar]].
==Personal life== Penny is married to Robert Powers, a producer/artist and they live in New York City. Together they have restored two homes in California and are currently renovating an 1890âs Victorian. Sydney and Robert live with two Siamese cats, Slinky and Yo-yo. In her free time, Sydney enjoys playing tennis, riding horses, growing tomatoes, hiking, knitting, reading, listening to all types of music and watching classic films. Sydney sings, speaks French fluently and loves to travel anywhere there is good food.<ref>http://www.sydneypenny.net/</ref>
They welcomed their first child, a son, on May 31, 2007.<ref>[http://www.celebrity-babies.com/2007/06/a_son_for_all_m.html Update: A son for ''All My Children<nowiki>'</nowiki>''s Sydney Penny : Celebrity Baby Blog<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
